intro: Coleosanthus longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves that can grow up to several feet in length, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Coleosanthus longifolius plays a vital role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and stabilizing soil.
